meanings.definition: Willingness to believe or trust too readily; gullibility.
meanings.sent1: Her credulousnesses led her to fall for every scam that came her way.
meanings.sent2: His credulousnesses made him an easy target for con artists.
meanings.sent3: Despite her credulousnesses, she always had a kind heart.
meanings.sent4: His credulousnesses were like open doors inviting deception.
meanings.sent5: The town's credulousnesses towards the stranger's claims caused chaos.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being credulous.
meanings.sent1: The credulousnesses of the audience made them believe the magician's tricks were real.
meanings.sent2: In a world full of deceit, credulousnesses can be a dangerous trait.
meanings.sent3: The credulousnesses of the children made them believe in fairy tales.
meanings.sent4: His credulousnesses shone through when he fell for the prank without question.
meanings.sent5: The politician took advantage of the public's credulousnesses to gain power.
